name: selenium-webdriver
description: The official WebDriver JavaScript bindings from the Selenium project.

name: WD
description: WebDriver/Selenium 2 node.js client.

name: WebdriverIO
description: better implementation of WebDriver bindings with predefined 50+ actions.

name: Zombie.js
description: Insanely fast, headless full-stack testing.

name: SlimerJS
description: A scriptable browser for Web developers.

name: Nightwatch
description: efficient and straightforward Javascript End-to-End tests.

name: Karma
description: Brings a productive testing environment to developers for unit testing (mostly AngularJS).

name: Protractor
description: Protractor is an end-to-end test framework for AngularJS applications.

name: CodeceptJS
description: Modern Era Acceptance Testing Framework for NodeJS.

name: Selenium with Ruby
description: Selenium Ruby bindings

name: Watir
description: Automated testing that doesn’t hurt

name: Anemone
description: Anemone web-spider framework.

name: Mechanize
description: automating interaction with websites.

name: Spidr
description: web spidering library that can spider a site, multiple domains, certain links or infinitely.

name: cobweb
description: web crawler that can use resque to cluster crawls to quickly crawl extremely large sites.

name: Capybara
description: an integration testing tool for rack based web applications. It simulates how a user would interact with a website.

name: Facebook WebDriver
description: A PHP client for webdriver.

name: Selenium Setup
description: A tool for PHP developers to start their own Selenium server.

name: Steward
description: A test runner integrating php-webdriver with PHPUnit.

name: Selenium with Python
description: Selenium Python bindings

name: Helium
description: Helium makes Selenium easier and faster to use

name: Selene
description: Selenide-inspired concise and readable automated test framework, supports Ajax well like Selenide.

name: mechanize
description: Stateful programmatic web browsing.

name: Robot
description: Robot Framework is a generic test automation framework for acceptance testing and ATDD.

name: behave-webdriver behavior driven testing with Selenium and Python.
Selenium with Java
description: Selenium Java bindings

name: Conductor
description: Turbo-boosted Selenium framework that makes test writing a breeze.

name: darcy
description: Page object framework for structured, maintainable automation.

name: Selenide
description: A framework for writing easy-to-read and easy-to-maintain automated tests using a Fluent API. Selenide has a magic trick that resolves most problems with Ajax and timeouts.

name: Galen Framework
description: Automated testing of look and feel for your responsive websites.

name: Serenity
description: It is an open source library for writing better quality automated acceptance tests faster. (Formerly Thucydides).

name: seleniumQuery
description: jQuery-like cross-driver interface in Java for WebDriver. Designed as a thin layer, it can be used alone or on top of your favorite framework just to make some cases (e.g. asserting/waiting) simpler when needed.

name: WebDriverManager
description: Automatic management of Selenium WebDriver binaries.

name: Lightning
description: Lightweight and lightning fast WebDriver client.

name: Selenium with C#
description: Selenium C# bindings

name: Atata
description: Automated web testing full featured framework based on Selenium WebDriver.

name: Strontium
description: A .NET implementation (but outdated) for Selenium/WebDriver (Remote) Server

name: Geb
description: It can be used for scripting, scraping and general automation — or equally as a functional/web/acceptance testing solution via integration with testing frameworks such as Spock, JUnit & TestNG.

name: dart.webdriver
description: Provides WebDriver bindings for Dart. These use the WebDriver JSON interface, and as such, require the use of the WebDriver remote server.

name: WebdriverCSS
description: Regression testing tool for WebdriverIO (currently deprecated, please use wdio-screenshot for the time being).

name: elgalu/docker-selenium
description: Selenium in Docker with Chrome & Firefox plus video recording support.

name: Ggr
description: A lightweight load balancer used to create big Selenium clusters.

name: SeleniumHQ/docker-selenium
description: Docker images for Selenium Standalone Server, Hub, and Node configurations with Chrome and Firefox.

name: Selenoid
description: A lightweight Selenium hub implementation launching browsers in Docker containers.

name: zalando/zalenium
description: Allows anyone to have a disposable and flexible Selenium Grid infrastructure

name: bravostudiodev/bravo-grid
description: Docker image/setup for Selenium Grid Extras (see under Selenium Grid section), for providing remote Sikuli test/automation execution and grid node file upload/download support.

name: kubernetes/examples
description: Example deployment of Selenium Hub and Nodes on a Kubernetes cluster

name: Moon
description: A commercial closed-source enterprise Selenium implementation using Kubernetes to launch browsers

name: Callisto
description: An open-source tool to launch browsers in Kubernetes. Separate is created for each selenium session.

name: WebGrid
description: An open-source, decentralized, scalable and robust selenium-grid equivalent.

name: Firefox
description: Firefox driver (for FF < v48) is included in the selenium-server-standalone.jar available in the downloads.

name: Geckodriver
description: Firefox driver (for FF > v48), supported with Selenium >= v3

name: Chrome
description: ChromeDriver is a standalone server which implements WebDriver's wire protocol for Chromium.

name: Internet Explorer
description: The InternetExplorerDriver is a standalone server which implements WebDriver's wire protocol.

name: Edgedriver
description: Microsoft Webdriver server for Edge

name: Safari
description: The SafariDriver is implemented as a Safari browser extension. The driver inverts the traditional client/server relationship and communicates with the WebDriver client using WebSockets (only supported for Safari <= v9, all new Safari version comming with macOS Sierra come with an integrated SafariDriver that is closed source by Apple).

name: Opera
description: OperaDriver is a vendor-supported WebDriver implementation developed by Opera Software and volunteers that implements WebDriver API for Opera.

name: Appium
description: Appium is an open source test automation framework for use with native and hybrid mobile apps. It drives iOS, Android Apps using the WebDriver protocol.

name: Selendroid
description: Selendroid is based on the Android instrumentation framework.

name: ios-driver
description: Test any IOS native, hybrid, or mobile web application using Selenium / WebDriver.

name: WebDriverAgent
description: a WebDriver server for iOS to remote control devices via WebDriver API.

name: WinAppDriver
description: Microsoft's WebDriver implementation for Windows application automation.

name: Winium
description: Automation framework for Windows platforms. It is free. It is opensource. It is Selenium-based. Supports: Windows Desktop (WPF, WinForms); Windows Store or Universal Apps for Windows Phone; Windows Phone Silverlight Apps.

name: QtWebDriver
description: For using WebDriver to automate Qt-based GUI applications.

name: AutoItDriverServer
description: Selenium server to control/drive AutoIt via (Remote)WebDriver API.

name: AutoPyDriverServer
description: Selenium server to control/drive AutoPy via (Remote)WebDriver API.

name: Appium for Mac
description: Appium/WebDriver implementation for automating Mac OS X desktop.

name: SilkAppDriver
description: Selenium server to control/drive the commercial SilkTest platform via (Remote)WebDriver API.

name: SWET
description: A successor to SWD Page Recorder, for the same functionality.

name: Looking Glass
description: Java application that offers a cross-browser element inspector and Selenium code generator.

name: Ranorex Selocity
description: A Firebug/FirePath/Firefinder and Selenium IDE alternative for browser element inspection from the creators of Ranorex.

name: Silk WebDriver
description: A Selenium IDE alternative for record, playback, and script export, from the creators of SilkTest.

name: Fire IE Selenium
description: Microsoft Excel-based tool providing element inspection for Internet Explorer browser.

name: Selenium Grid Extras
description: A framework that provides additional features beyond the basic Selenium Grid like video recording.

name: SeLion
description: A (Java) framework for running Selenium tests with additional features beyond the basic Selenium Grid functionality, particularly like stability improvements, etc.

name: Selenium Grid Extensions
description: A set of extensions for Selenium Grid that provide additional features like running Sikuli tests/automation remotely, upload/download files on a grid node.

name: Sauce Labs
description: Cross browser testing made awesome. Selenium testing, mobile testing, JS unit testing on 300+ OS/browser platforms. Get started for free.

name: HeadSpin
description: Test your website for cross browser compatibility on thousands of real device running real browsers. Get instant access to multiple desktop and mobile browsers on the cloud. Get Free Trial.

name: Browserstack
description: Test your website for cross browser compatibility on real browsers. Instant access to multiple desktop and mobile browsers. Get Free Trial.

name: LambdaTest
description: Test your website for cross browser compatibility on 2000+ real browsers & OS. Get Free Trial.

name: TestingBot
description: TestingBot provides easy cross browser testing with Selenium in the cloud.

name: Moon Cloud
description: Your dedicated Selenium cluster in public cloud platform with per-minute billing and unlimited number of browsers.

name: Mail7
description: Disposable email service to automate the email workflow testing, This document explains how to implement Mail7 with Selenium

name: Thundra Foresight
description: A visibility tool into your test suites by spotting test failures in no time.

name: OpenSTF
description: A framework for running your own device farm, geared toward Android, but also iOS.

name: Scrapy
description: Python, mainly a scraper/miner - fast, well documented and, can be linked with Django Dynamic Scraper for nice mining deployments, or Scrapy Cloud for PaaS (server-less) deployment, works in terminal or an server stand-alone process, can be used with Celery, built on top of Twisted.

name: Node-Crawler
description: Node.js Web Crawler/Spider for NodeJS + server-side jQuery.

name: The WebDriver Wire Protocol
description: All implementations of WebDriver that communicate with the browser, or a RemoteWebDriver server shall use a common wire protocol.

name: WebDriver
description: This specification defines the WebDriver API, a platform and language-neutral interface and associated wire protocol that allows programs or scripts to introspect into, and control the behavior of, a web browser.

name: Official Selenium Blog
description: The official blog by SeleniumHQ.

name: Elemental Selenium
description: A free, once-weekly e-mail on how to use Selenium like a Pro.

name: SauceLabs Blog
description: Blog curated by SauceLabs.
